page.title: 13Rowallan Creamery
page.content: Founded in 1888 by three farmers under the name of "John Wallace & Co. N.B." (North Britain), in 1926 under the new ownership of Mr.Mair and Mr.Caddis it was renamed "Rowallan Creamery" after the nearby Rowallan Castle. It is the oldest creamery in Britain standing on its original site. The modern three storey administration building, factory, canteen etc.take up five acres of land. There are in total 250 employees, 105 male and 145 female. Margarine and cooking fats are produced from imported oils of many kinds and to a minor degree from rape seed. Under the trade name "Banquet", Rowallan margarine is sold all over Britain and Northern Ireland; under other names it is sold by supermarkets and chain stores e.g.Tesco and Marks and Spencers.
